文献ID: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_042_chunk3
证据片段: the oxide layer grows uniformly up to 5 μm thickness and then follows a nonuniform growth pattern with nucleation of the white granular oxides

文献ID: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_042_chunk3
证据片段: the white granular oxide-covered layer does involve the formation of macro-pores or cracks and by contrast the uniform black oxide layer is very dense with little macro-pores

文献ID: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_042_chunk3
证据片段: thermal conductivity of the irradiated oxide layer of 21 to 33 μm is 30% less than that of the unirradiated oxide layer with no white granular oxides nucleated
样品状态: irradiated oxide layer, unirradiated oxide layer

文献ID: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_042_chunk3
证据片段: in-reactor corrosion becomes enhanced when the oxide thickness reaches about 5 μm together with the transition of the oxide layer from black to gray

文献ID: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_042_chunk4
证据片段: the amount of hydrogen absorbed by an intact Zircaloy-4 cladding when corroded to the layer thickness of 52 to 58 μm was several hundreds ppm H (278 to 424 ppm H)

文献ID: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_042_chunk4

文献ID: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_042_chunk4

文献ID: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_042_chunk5

文献ID: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_042_chunk5
证据片段: enhanced corrosion occurs on the hottest part of the defective cladding where the heavily concentrated hydrides precipitate at the cold outer surface

文献ID: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_042_chunk5
证据片段: corrosion enhancement by hydrides is likely to occur late in the fuel life time or after more than three or four cycles of irradiation
